trans-unit.source: 1st line explained: It matches PATH.EXT or ANYTHING and replaces it with EXT. If ANYTHING was matched, the ext group is not captured.
trans-unit.target: 第1行解释。它匹配了PATH.EXT或ANYTHING,并将其替换为EXT。如果匹配了ANYTHING,则不捕获EXT组。

trans-unit.source: extension=${filename##*.} does not include the initial ., contrary to convention.
trans-unit.target: extension=${filename##*.} 不包括缩写 . ，违反约定。

trans-unit.source: filename="${filename%.*}" will be the empty string, if the input file name starts with . and contains no further . characters (e.g., .bash_profile) - contrary to convention.
trans-unit.target: filename="${filename%.*}" 如果输入的文件名以开头，则filename =“ $ {filename％。*}”将为空字符串 . 并且没有进一步的内容 . 字符（例如 .bash_profile ）-违反约定。

trans-unit.source: Caveats: Splits on the last dot, which works well for filenames with dots in them, but not well for extensions with dots in them. See example below.
trans-unit.target: 注意事项：在最后一个点上分割，这对于其中带有点的文件名效果很好，但对于其中带有点的扩展名效果不佳。请参见下面的示例。

I wrapped it all up in a little, slightly more comprehensible, reusable function for my (or your) .bash_profile that takes care of what (I consider) should be a more robust version of dirname/basename / what have you..

trans-unit.source: Split the pathname path into a pair (root, ext) such that root + ext == path, and ext is empty or begins with a period and contains at most one period. Leading periods on the basename are ignored; splitext('.cshrc') returns ('.cshrc', '').
trans-unit.target: 将路径名path分成一对 (root, ext) ，使得 root + ext == path ，并且ext为空或以一个句点开头，并且最多包含一个句点。基本名称的前导句号将被忽略； splitext('.cshrc') ('.cshrc', '') ）返回（'.cshrc'，''）。

trans-unit.source: The accepted answer works well in typical cases, but fails in edge cases, namely:
trans-unit.target: 该接受的答案行之有效的典型案例，但在失败边缘的情况下，即：

trans-unit.source: The best solution I found so far is:
trans-unit.target: 到目前为止,我找到的最好的解决方案是:

trans-unit.source: The command for EXTENSION substitutes a any number of characters followed by a "." character at the start of the line, with nothing (i.e., it removes everything from the start of the line to the final dot, inclusive). This is a greedy substitution which is the default action.
trans-unit.target: 用于 EXTENSION 的命令将替换任意数量的字符，后跟 "." 行开头的字符，没有任何内容（即，它删除了从行开头到最后一个点的所有内容）。这是一个贪婪的替换，这是默认操作。

trans-unit.source: The command for NAME substitutes a "." character followed by any number of non-"." characters up to the end of the line, with nothing (i.e., it removes everything from the final "." to the end of the line, inclusive). This is basically a non-greedy substitution using regex trickery.
trans-unit.target: NAME 的命令替换为 "." 字符，后跟任意数量的非 "." 直到行尾的所有字符，没有任何内容（即，它将从最后的 "." 到行尾（包括首尾）删除所有内容）。这基本上是使用正则表达式欺骗的非贪婪替代。

trans-unit.target: 顺便说一下,这些命令的工作原理如下:

trans-unit.source: There's a caveat in that if your filename was of the form ./somefile.tar.gz then echo ${FILENAME%%.*} would greedily remove the longest match to the . and you'd have the empty string.
trans-unit.target: 需要注意的是，如果您的文件名采用 ./somefile.tar.gz 格式,则 echo ${FILENAME%%.*} 将贪婪地删除与匹配的最长匹配项 . 并且您会有空字符串。

trans-unit.source: To expand on the POSIX variables answer, note that you can do more interesting patterns. So for the case detailed here, you could simply do this:
trans-unit.target: 要扩展POSIX变量 answer，请注意，您可以执行更多有趣的模式。因此，对于此处详述的情况，您可以简单地执行以下操作：

trans-unit.source: To skip variables not of interest that come before those that are, specify _ (to use throw-away variable $_) or ''; e.g., to extract filename root and extension only, use splitPath '/etc/bash.bashrc' _ _ fnameroot extension.
trans-unit.target: 要跳过不感兴趣的变量，请指定 _ （以使用抛弃型变量 $_ ）或 '' ；例如，要仅提取文件名root和扩展名，请使用 splitPath '/etc/bash.bashrc' _ _ fnameroot extension 。

trans-unit.source: Under Linux and other unixen, there is a magic command named file, that do filetype detection by analysing some first bytes of file. This is a very old tool, initialy used for print servers (if not created for... I'm not sure about that).
trans-unit.target: 在Linux和其他unixen下，有一个名为 file 的魔术命令，该命令通过分析文件的第一个字节来进行文件类型检测。这是一个非常古老的工具，最初用于打印服务器（如果不是为...创建的，我不确定）。
